bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, December 14, 1900

div1.p: Lawrence Reed describes a wedding at the base. His friend Cooke will visit Emilie Lawrence Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, December 14, 1900
div1.p:
I found your letter which
I received last Sunday in my unanswered
“pigeon hole for letters, and while I am
almost sure I have written you this week
still I will write you again- I know
the last letter I wrote you I enclosed $10.00
but I cant recall when it was-

Well Humber and Miss Gerduin were
married at 3.00 P.M. yesterday and
left on the transport at 500 for the States
The wedding & bride were very pretty
but poor H. was trembling all over-
I had a dandy good time with about
20 lbs of rice -- and yards & yards of white
ribbon-

Cooke also left on the same
boat for Georgetown so you will
see him shortly and he will tell
all about the place -- etc-

Will write again Sunday so will best
love for you & Blossom I am
